componentDescription:
The Collapse transition is used by the
[Vertical Stepper](/material-ui/react-stepper/#vertical-stepper) StepContent component.
It uses [react-transition-group](https://github.com/reactjs/react-transition-group) internally.

addEndListener.description: Add a custom transition end trigger. Called with the transitioning DOM node and a done callback. Allows for more fine grained transition end logic. Note: Timeouts are still used as a fallback if provided.

children.description: The content node to be collapsed.

classes.description: Override or extend the styles applied to the component.

collapsedSize.description: The width (horizontal) or height (vertical) of the container when collapsed.

component.description: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
component.notes: ⚠️ Needs to be able to hold a ref.

easing.description: The transition timing function. You may specify a single easing or a object containing enter and exit values.

in.description: If true, the component will transition in.

sx.description: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles.

timeout.description:
The duration for the transition, in milliseconds. You may specify a single timeout for all transitions, or individually with an object.
Set to 'auto' to automatically calculate transition time based on height.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.
